p: There are two epidemiological types of VL: zoonotic visceral leishmaniasis (ZVL), which is transmitted from dogs to humans, and anthroponotic visceral leishmaniasis (AVL), which is transmitted from human to human, both through an insect vector cycle. VL is the most severe form of leishmaniasis, where vital organs such as the spleen, liver, and bone marrow are affected, which involves immunosuppression and can be fatal if left untreated ( 31). Even among treated patients, therapeutic failure was detected in up to 10% of cases ( 68).
